section.title: Test Case Details
section.p: Complete this form with the details of the test case to be created.

A test case is a set of input values, execution preconditions, expected results and execution postconditions, developed for a particular objective or test condition, such as to exercise a particular program path or to verify compliance with a specific requirement.

section.title: Requirements
section.p: A condition or capability needed by a user to solve a problem or achieve an objective that must be met or possessed by a system or system component to satisfy a contract, standard, specification, or other formally imposed document. i.e. User Story/EPIC/MR or Improvement.
Note: Multiple Requirement Id's can be listed.

section.title: Test Case ID
section.p: Unique ID assigned to your test case that should NEVER be changed. Recommendation is to use a reference to parent requirement of feature. E.g TORF-1234_AddNode_Func1

section.title: Title
section.p: Brief description of your test case.

section.title: Description
section.p: Describe the goal of the test case.

section.title: Precondition
section.p: Environmental and state conditions that must be fulfilled before the component or system can be executed with a particular test or test procedure.

section.title: Product
section.p: Please select the product to which the test case belongs.

section.title: Feature
section.p: Corresponds to the feature/feature area i.e. PM , FM, CM where test cases were written. A feature is a unit of work that fulfills a requirement.

section.title: Component
section.p: The component is the underlying module of a feature.

section.title: Type
section.p: A group of test activities aimed at testing a component or system focused on a specific test objective, i.e. functional test, usability test, regression test etc. A test type may take place on one or more test levels or test phases.

section.title: Priority
section.p: The level of business importance assigned to a test case.

section.title: Group
section.p: The test phase the test case is applicable for. E.g. KGB, GAT.

section.title: Context
section.p: The technology used to interface to the system under test(SUT).

section.title: Execution Type
section.p: The type of test case execution: Manual or Automated.

section.title: Automation Candidate
section.p: Select whether this test case is a candidate for automation. Options available are 'Yes' and 'No'.

section.title: Status
section.p: State of the design of the test case specification.

section.title: Test Steps
section.p: Ordered list of actions against the SUT with validation of responses.

section.title: Test Step Details
section.p: 'Test Step Description': Describe the goal of the test step.
'Test Step Data': Any additional data relating to this test step should be included in this field.

section.title: Verify Step
section.p: Expected outcomes that should occur when the associated test step is carried out.

section.title: Icons Description
section.p: 'Results': Navigates to test case results.
'Create': Adds the test case created below to the Database.
'Cancel': Cancels the creation of the current test case and returns to test case Results page.

section.title: Intrusive
section.p: Intrusive testing can be considered a type of interrupt testing, which is used to test how well a system reacts to intrusions and interrupts to its normal workflow.
Non-Intrusive testing that is transparent to the software under test, i.e., does not change its timing or processing characteristics.
Reason input field used to explain the users choice for intrusive or non intrusive.

section.title: Team
section.p: The name of the team that originally wrote the test case.

section.title: Suite
section.p: The name of the suite to which the test case has been added.
